meanings.definition: A type of glycoprotein consisting of a core protein with covalently attached glycosaminoglycan chains.
meanings.sent1: The proteoglycans in our body help maintain the structure of our tissues.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study proteoglycans to understand their role in the body.
meanings.sent3: The proteoglycans at the party were the life of the extracellular matrix!
meanings.sent4: Her love for proteoglycans was as strong as the covalent bonds holding them together.
meanings.sent5: The proteoglycans acted like tiny architects, building the framework of the tissues.

meanings.definition: Proteoglycans are essential components of the extracellular matrix in connective tissues.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how proteoglycans support our connective tissues.
meanings.sent2: Athletes need proteoglycans to keep their joints healthy and strong.
meanings.sent3: The proteoglycans threw a party in the extracellular matrix, inviting all the cells!
meanings.sent4: In the web of life, proteoglycans are the strong threads holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The proteoglycans sparkled like gems in the intricate tapestry of connective tissues.
